snippet: Families of the Granite Mountain Hotshots who perished in an Arizona wildfire remembered their loved ones’ first words, final text messages and goodbyes, and everything in between.
abstract: Families of the Granite Mountain Hotshots, firefighters who perished in an Arizona wildfire, recall their loved ones' last words before they left home, final text messages and goodbyes; 19 men, as fit as athletes and as well trained as soldiers, perished, many of them leaving infants and pregnant wives behind.

byline.original: By JACK HEALY and IAN LOVETT
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Fernanda Santos and Ray Rivera from Prescott, Dan Frosch from Denver, and Emma G. Fitzsimmons from New York. Jack Begg contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Families of the Granite Mountain Hotshots who perished in an Arizona wildfire remembered their loved ones’ first words, final text messages and goodbyes, and everything in between.

headline.main: Boys With Firefighting Dreams, and Goodbyes That Turned Final
